alert.note: Alert for Summers (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 3:19PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Summers County through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hinton, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Locally heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Ponding of water on roads and minor flooding of low-lying areas is possible. Locations impacted include... Hinton... Sandstone... Buck... Bluestone State Park... Jumping Branch... Hix... and Bluestone Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
